TopicTitle: Could someone do a calculation for me? and maybe show me how?

Articles.Content:
the calculation that i want done is this:

how much fuel do 8 LV-1R engines need to burn for exactly the same length of time (at full throttle) as one RT-10 solid booster.

and the same question but for 8 Rockomax 24-77 engines.

I would love to know how to work this out for myself, so if you could show me your working, and what equations you used that would be great

It seems like a simple fuel flow rate problem.

From the Wiki :

Fuel con.sumption (LV-1R) (1 atm) 0.37 l/s

(vacuum) 0.28 l/s

I'm going to round to .35 for the purposes of this calculation. Meaning that 8 LV-1Rs uses about 2.8 l/s

The Fuel consumption for an RT-10 is (1 atm) 15.09 l/s

(vacuum) 14.14 l/s

Again, I'm going to round to 14.5 l/s The Burn time for the RT-10 is (1 atm) 28.7 s Or about 29 sec.

(vacuum) 30.6 s

So, our 8 LV-1Rs need about 28 units of Liquid Fuel, and an appropriate amount of Oxidizer, but for what it's worth you might as well just reduce the thrust of the RT-10.

Fuel flux x time, but remember that the flux is not exactly constant, and if you want more accurate results, do:

Solid fuel mass / solid fuel flux = SRB time

SRB time = LFE(liquid fuel engine) time

LF/OX mass (total!!) = fuel flux x LFE time

Cheers!!

And in case it matters to you: 11 units of oxidizer per 9 units of fuel

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Liquid_fuel
